title: 105_hr1916
content: The Act is titled the "Government Shutdown Prevention Act" and it involves continuing funding. The "Government Shutdown Prevention Act" appropriates funds from the Treasury to continue programs from fiscal year 1997 at 100% of the previous year's rate. Funds allocated for programs in fiscal year 1998 under the Government Shutdown Prevention Act will be available during a lapse in appropriations until the regular appropriation bill for fiscal year 1998 becomes law or until the end of fiscal year 1998. SEC. 3. TERMS AND CONDITIONS: Appropriations for fiscal year 1998 will follow the terms and conditions of fiscal year 1997. Appropriations made by this Act will follow the pertinent appropriations Act. SEC. 4. COVERAGE. SEC. 4. COVERAGE. Appropriations and funds for fiscal year 1998 under this Act cover all obligations or expenditures incurred for a program, project, or activity during that fiscal year. SEC. 5. EXPENDITURES. Expenditures for fiscal year 1998 programs will be charged to the appropriate appropriation when a regular appropriation bill or continuing resolution becomes law. SEC. 6. INITIATING OR RESUMING A PROGRAM, PROJECT, OR ACTIVITY. SEC. 6. INITIATING OR RESUMING A PROGRAM, PROJECT, OR ACTIVITY. No funds from this Act can be used to start or restart any program without available appropriations from fiscal year 1997. SEC. 7. PROTECTION OF OTHER OBLIGATIONS. This Act does not affect obligations mandated by other laws such as Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, and veterans benefits. SEC. 8. DEFINITION. The term "regular appropriation bill" in this Act refers to annual bills that allocate funds for various categories of programs and activities, including agriculture, rural development, defense, education, and housing. The regular appropriation bill allocates funds for various programs and activities, including energy, water development, foreign assistance, the Department of the Interior, military construction, transportation, Treasury Department, U.S. Postal Service, Executive Office of the President, independent agencies, and the legislative branch.
